intro: Ionoxalis calcaria, commonly known as the rock buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a heart-shaped base. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features small, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, round seed pods. Ionoxalis calcaria is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
